designSystem.name: Modern Landing Page Design System
designSystem.overview: A comprehensive, reusable design system for creating modern SaaS and product landing pages with high conversion potential

primary.description: Main brand color used for CTAs, links, and key interactive elements

secondary.description: Supporting brand color for accents and variety

accent.description: 1-2 additional colors for visual variety and emphasis

rules: Choose 1 primary color that represents brand energy
Select 1-2 complementary or analogous secondary colors
Test all colors for WCAG AA contrast compliance
Create light and dark variations for each brand color

fontPairing.option1: Single modern sans-serif (Inter, Poppins, DM Sans, Outfit)
fontPairing.option3: Geometric sans + Humanist sans (Montserrat headings + Open Sans body)
fontPairing.recommendation: Use 1-2 font families maximum, vary with weight and size

sectionStructure.name: Navigation Header
sectionStructure.background: Transparent with blur on scroll, or solid

sectionStructure.name: Social Proof Bar
sectionStructure.layout: Horizontal row of logos or single stat line

sectionStructure.name: Showcase / Product Details
sectionStructure.layout: Large visual with feature callouts or tabs
sectionStructure.structure: 60% visual | 40% text or full-width with overlays

sectionStructure.name: Footer
sectionStructure.structure: Company info | Products | Resources | Legal | Newsletter

secondary.style: Similar padding and shape to primary

featureCard.iconBackground: Light tint of brand color or accent

pricingCard.featuredStyle: Elevated, border highlight, or scale slightly larger

input.focusState: Border color changes to primary, outline glow

layout.horizontal: Side-by-side for related fields (first name | last name)

desktop.hover: Underline, color change, or subtle background

icons.color: Match text color or use primary/accent

types.hero: High-quality product mockups or lifestyle imagery
types.background: Subtle textures, gradients, or blurred images

images.optimization: WebP format, lazy loading, responsive images

dividers.usage: Separate major sections or create visual breaks

patterns: Text left → Text right → Text left (alternating)

visual: Size: Larger elements draw attention first
Color: Bright colors attract before muted
Contrast: High contrast elements stand out
Position: Top and center viewed first
Motion: Animated elements catch the eye

whitespace.principle: Use generous whitespace for breathing room
application: Line length (60-75 characters max for readability)

techniques: Size contrast (large headline vs. small text)

principles: Use for feedback and delight, not decoration

hero.include: Who it's for or key differentiator

section.optional: Can be omitted if headline is self-explanatory

principles: Remove friction (mention free, no credit card)

layout: All multi-column layouts become single column
Hero can remain split or stack
Navigation stays horizontal or becomes mobile

touchTargets.buttons: Full-width on mobile for primary CTAs (optional)

optimization: Lazy load images below the fold

requirements: Color contrast 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text
Semantic HTML (header, nav, main, section, footer)
Proper heading hierarchy (single h1, logical nesting)
Alt text for all meaningful images
Focus indicators visible on all interactive elements
ARIA labels where semantic HTML insufficient

principles: Clear value proposition above the fold
Reduce friction (free trials, no credit card)

psychology.reciprocity: Free trials, free resources, free tools
psychology.commitment: Small asks first (email) before big asks (purchase)
psychology.clarity: Remove ambiguity, be specific about outcomes

forAI: Start by defining the brand colors (primary, secondary, accent, neutrals)
Choose typography scale appropriate to brand personality
Select 5-8 key sections from layoutArchitecture based on product needs
Use componentLibrary specifications to build consistent UI elements
Ensure responsiveDesign transformations for all screen sizes
Implement accessibility requirements from the start
adaptationGuidance: This system is a foundation - adapt based on brand personality
Conservative brands: Use subtle colors, more whitespace, serif fonts
Tech/Modern brands: Bold colors, geometric shapes, sans-serif fonts
Creative brands: Asymmetric layouts, vibrant colors, unique typography
Enterprise/B2B: Professional tone, data-focused, trust indicators
Consumer/B2C: Emotional appeal, lifestyle imagery, simpler language
Not all sections required - choose based on product complexity
Maintain 60-30-10 color rule regardless of brand colors chosen
Keep hierarchy principles even when styling changes
Consistency matters more than following every specification exactly

quickStart.step2: Map content needs to section types

socialProofBar.include: Have recognizable client logos or impressive metrics

howItWorks.include: Product is complex or has multiple steps
howItWorks.skip: Product is self-explanatory or very simple

statistics.skip: No meaningful metrics to share yet

testimonials.include: Have 3+ quality testimonials with real names
testimonials.skip: No testimonials yet (focus on other trust elements)

pricing.skip: Enterprise sales or custom pricing only

faq.include: Common questions exist that block conversions
faq.skip: Product is straightforward with no common blockers

team.include: Team expertise is a selling point (consulting, agency)
team.skip: Product sells itself, team not relevant

professional.colors: Navy, gray, muted blue - conservative palette
professional.typography: Serif headings or clean sans-serif, traditional hierarchy

innovative.colors: Bright primary with electric accents, high contrast
innovative.examples: Tech startups, AI products, SaaS platforms

friendly.colors: Warm colors (orange, yellow, soft blue), approachable

luxury.colors: Black, gold, deep jewel tones, minimal palette
luxury.examples: Premium products, luxury services, high-end brands

playful.typography: Geometric or rounded sans-serif, varied sizes

minimal.imagery: Simple, focused, lots of negative space

saas.emphasis: Product screenshots, free trial CTAs, feature depth
saas.trustElements: User count, security badges, uptime guarantees

ecommerce.emphasis: Product imagery, clear pricing, easy checkout path
ecommerce.trustElements: Reviews, return policy, secure payment icons

agency.emphasis: Portfolio work, case studies, team expertise
agency.trustElements: Client logos, awards, years in business

mobileApp.emphasis: App store badges, in-app screenshots, mobile-first design
mobileApp.trustElements: Star ratings, download count, featured placements

marketplace.emphasis: Two-sided value prop, search functionality, safety

principles: Clear what product does in 3-5 seconds
Trust indicator present (logo bar, rating, user count)
aboveTheFold.testing: View on smallest target device without scrolling

progressiveDisclosure.strategy: Reveal information as user scrolls deeper
progressiveDisclosure.principle: Each section builds confidence toward conversion

heroFormulas.questionAnswer: Struggling with X? → Here's how to solve it

featureToBenefit.application: Always lead with benefit, feature is supporting detail

testimonialStructure.length: 2-4 sentences ideal, one powerful sentence minimum

visual: Typography hierarchy clear at all sizes

analytics.tools: Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Hotjar, Microsoft Clarity

abTesting.methodology: Test one variable at a time, minimum 95% confidence

heatmaps.actions: Optimize based on actual user behavior patterns

userFeedback.application: Address common confusion or friction points

avoid.fix: Keep hero concise, move details below
Lead with specific benefits, avoid jargon
Be specific about what user gets
Lead with outcomes, support with features
